column6: Very sensitive skin. These were great. Magnolia doesn‚Äôt smell as strong as the pomegranate.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021
column14: I don‚Äôt normally like exfoliating body wash but thought I‚Äôd give it a go after an eczema flair up. I‚Äôm super sensitive to dyes as well as artificial, drying soaps. I tried both snd neither caused an issue. I used to love their Rose body wash but my local stores no longer carry it so I thought the combo would be nice to try. The Pomegranate Mango exfoliating body wash doesn‚Äôt have those annoying super thick granules so I was pleasantly surprised. Maybe it‚Äôs a natural exfoliating mixture without the tiny granules. Definitely smelled stronger than the Magnolia but not in an overpowering way at all. The other is just much more subtle so I will probably stick with the Pom Mango or alternate when I need some exfoliation. My eczema flare up has calmed down after using these soaps. I wanted to try something new bec I got tired of repeatedly using the Tea Tree (which is great for soothing tired muscles and such) and the other options just didn‚Äôt compare to the smell of these with the exception of the Rose. So I will continue buying the set. It‚Äôs a great deal to get two in one delivery. I recommend:)
